# Introduction

This report presents a catches data loaded from a xlsx file. 
The report has a fantastic illustration of catches over the years

```{r setup, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(readxl)
```

# Load Data

```{r load-data}

data <- read_excel("../data/20260626_test_data.xlsx")

# Show first rows
head(data)
```

# Data Preparation

```{r prepare-data}
# Convert Date column to Date type (if exists)
if("Date" %in% colnames(data)){
  data$Date <- as.Date(data$Date)
}
```

# Summary Statistics

```{r summary}
summary(data)
```

# Line Plot

```{r line-plot}
  ggplot(data, aes(x = as.factor(Year), y = Catches)) +
    geom_line(color = "blue", linewidth = 1) +
    labs(
      title = "Catches",
      x = "Year",
      y = "Catch"
    ) +
    theme_minimal()
```
